com.conductor.kafka.hadoop
Class KafkaInputFormat

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.InputFormat<LongWritable,BytesWritable>
      com.conductor.kafka.hadoop.KafkaInputFormat

public class KafkaInputFormat
extends InputFormat<LongWritable,BytesWritable>

An InputFormat that splits up Kafka Broker-Partitions further into a set of offsets.

Specifically, it will call SimpleConsumer.getOffsetsBefore(kafka.javaapi.OffsetRequest) to retrieve a list of valid offsets, and create N number of InputSplits per Broker-Partition, where N is the number of offsets returned by SimpleConsumer.getOffsetsBefore(kafka.javaapi.OffsetRequest).

Thanks to Dongmin Yu for providing the inspiration for this code.

The original source code can be found on Github.

Author:
Casey Green
See Also:
KafkaInputSplit, KafkaRecordReader

getSplits

public static List<InputSplit> getSplits(Configuration conf,
                                         String topic,
                                         String group)
                                  throws IOException
Returns the topic splits of the consumer group that would be input to a Job configured with the provided conf

This information may be useful for calculating the number of reducers your job will need.

Note: At the very least, kafka.zk.connect must be set in conf.

Parameters:
conf - the conf, containing at least the kafka.zk.connect setting.
topic - the kafka topic of hypothetical job.
group - the consumer group of the hypothetical job
Returns:
the number of splits the hypothetical job would get.
Throws:
IOException

setIncludeOffsetsAfterTimestamp

public static void setIncludeOffsetsAfterTimestamp(Job job,
                                                   long timestamp)
Only consider partitions created approximately on or after timestamp.

Note that you are only guaranteed to get all data on or after timestamp, but you may get some data before the specified timestamp.

Parameters:
job - the job being configured.
timestamp - the timestamp.
See Also:
SimpleConsumer.getOffsetsBefore(kafka.javaapi.OffsetRequest)

getIncludeOffsetsAfterTimestamp

public static long getIncludeOffsetsAfterTimestamp(Configuration conf)
Gets the offset timestamp set by setIncludeOffsetsAfterTimestamp(Job, long), returning 0 by default.

Parameters:
conf - the job conf.
Returns:
the offset timestamp, 0 by default.

setMaxSplitsPerPartition

public static void setMaxSplitsPerPartition(Job job,
                                            int maxSplits)
Limits the number of splits to create per partition.

Note that it if there more partitions to consume than maxSplits, the input format will take the earliest Kafka partitions.

Parameters:
job - the job to configure.
maxSplits - the maximum number of splits to create from each Kafka partition.

getMaxSplitsPerPartition

public static int getMaxSplitsPerPartition(Configuration conf)
Gets the maximum number of splits per partition set by setMaxSplitsPerPartition(Job, int), returning Integer.MAX_VALUE by default.

Parameters:
conf - the job conf
Returns:
the maximum number of splits, Integer.MAX_VALUE by default.

fetchSize - the fetch size (bytes).
